wikipedia_page.main: Sara Seale, was the pseudonym by Mary Jane MacPherson (d. (1974-03-11)11 March 1974) and/or A.D.L. MacPherson (d. (1978-10-30)30 October 1978), a British writing team of over 45 romance novels as  from 1932 to 1971. Seale was one of the first Mills & Boon's authors published in Germany and the Netherlands. By the 1950s Seale was earning over £3,000/year.

response: * Masquerade by Anne Mather / Rata Flowers Are Red by Mary Moore (author) / Unknown Mr. Brown by Sara Seale (1977)
*Golden Harlequin Library XLI: Over The Blue Mountains; Summer Lightning; Lucy Lamb; Doctor's Wife (1973) (with Sara Seale and Jill Tahourdin)
*Children's Nurse / Heart Specialist / Child Friday (1972) (Sara Seale and Kathryn Blair)
* Orphan Bride / Full Tide / House in the Timberwoods (1971) (with Celine Conway and Sara Seale)
* The Surgeon's Marriage / The Only Charity / The Golden Peaks (1964) (with Kathryn Blair and Sara Seale)
